title: Trip Planning Checklist
goal: I need a 10 day Travel Planning , with a $2500 budget . We love historical sites, hidden gems, and  culture . We want to explore cities on foot. I plan to propose during this trip and need a special location recommendation. Please provide a detailed itinerary and a simple HTML travel handbook with maps, attraction descriptions, essential local phrases, and travel tips we can reference throughout our journey.
content:
#  Trip Planning Checklist

## Research  Travel Basics
- [x] Create project directory structure
- [ ] Research best transportation options ( Pass, local transit)
- [ ] Research weather in April
- [ ] Check visa requirements 
- [ ] Research currency exchange and budget allocation
- [ ] Check flight options 

## Research Cities and Attractions
- [ ] Research  attractions and activities
- [ ] Research historical sites and cultural experiences
- [ ] Research surrounding attractions
- [ ] Research local food and cultural experiences
- [ ] Identify hidden gems and off-the-beaten-path locations
- [ ] Research cultural experiences 

## Plan 10-Day Itinerary
- [ ] Create day-by-day itinerary with timing
- [ ] Plan transportation between cities
- [ ] Balance city exploration with cultural experiences
- [ ] Include time for relaxation and spontaneous exploration
- [ ] Ensure itinerary fits within budget constraints ($5000)

## Research Proposal Locations
- [ ] Identify scenic and romantic locations for proposal
- [ ] Research best time of day for proposal at chosen locations
- [ ] Plan logistics for the proposal moment

## Compile local Phrases and Travel Tips
- [ ] Create list of essential local phrases
- [ ] Compile cultural etiquette tips
- [ ] Research dining customs and food recommendations
- [ ] Compile safety and emergency information

## Create HTML Travel Handbook
- [ ] Design structure for HTML handbook
- [ ] Create maps section with key locations
- [ ] Write attraction descriptions
- [ ] Include Japanese phrases section
- [ ] Add travel tips section
- [ ] Ensure mobile-friendly design

## Finalize and Deliver Documents
- [ ] Review and finalize 10-day itinerary
- [ ] Test HTML handbook functionality
- [ ] Compile all documents and resources
- [ ] Deliver final package to user

title: Conservation of Momentum Animations Project

content:
# Conservation of Momentum Animations Project

## Research Phase
- [ ] Research basic conservation of momentum concepts
- [ ] Identify key principles to demonstrate
- [ ] Find appropriate examples for middle school level
- [ ] Gather reference materials and equations

## Design Phase

- [ ] Design animation 2: Elastic collisions
- [ ] Design animation 3: Inelastic collisions

- [ ] Design animation 5: Real-world applications

## Development Phase
- [ ] Set up JavaScript animation framework
- [ ] Create animation 1: Basic collision demonstration
- [ ] Create animation 2: Elastic collisions
- [ ] Create animation 3: Inelastic collisions
- [ ] Create animation 4: Explosions
- [ ] Create animation 5: Real-world applications
- [ ] Add interactive elements (speed controls, reset buttons)

## Presentation Structure
- [ ] Create HTML structure for presentation
- [ ] Design simple, clean CSS for presentation
- [ ] Add navigation between animations
- [ ] Add explanatory text for each animation
- [ ] Add formulas and equations where appropriate

## Testing and Finalization
- [ ] Test all animations for accuracy
- [ ] Test presentation in browser
- [ ] Optimize for classroom display
- [ ] Prepare final package for delivery

## Delivery
- [ ] Deploy presentation
- [ ] Provide final URL to user
- [ ] Document any usage instructions

title: Vertical search AI solutions for fashion/Retail
goal: What vertical search AI solutions exist in the fashion industry? In which specific scenarios are they deployed? What are their pricing models? Which parts of the value chain do they serve? How do these products differentiate from one another?
content:
# Vertical Search AI Solution for Fashion/Retail

## Overview
Lily AI is a vertical AI solution purpose-built for retail that revolutionizes the retail value chain by enhancing product discovery and customer experience.

## Deployment Scenarios
Lily AI's solutions are deployed across the retail value chain in three main areas:

### Make (Product Creation)
- **Assortment and Purchase Planning**: Uses attribute depth across catalogs and past purchase data to identify similar proxy products and trends for buying decisions
- **Product Design to Product Onboarding**: Leverages a customized, human-powered product taxonomy with over 20,000 product attributes to design and describe new products with consumer preferences in mind

### Market (Product Marketing)
- **SEO and SEM**: Enhances organic search rankings by infusing descriptions, meta tags, and Google Merchant Feeds with consumer-oriented keywords
- **Retail Media**: Improves sponsored listings, personalization, and audience targeting to maximize click-through and conversion rates
- **Trend Campaigns**: Creates product collections based on trends and themes that can be converted into integrated marketing campaigns

### Sell (E-commerce)
- **Product Copy Generation**: Automates and optimizes product descriptions with AI-powered copy generation
- **Site Search**: Enhances search functionality by understanding conversational and dynamic language of consumers, displaying relevant search results for both branded and non-branded terms
- **Filters & Facets**: Automates product data enrichment to ensure products are listed in the right categories for discovery

## Value Chain Positioning
Lily AI serves the entire retail value chain from product creation ("Make") through marketing ("Market") to sales ("Sell"), with a particular focus on enhancing product discovery and search capabilities.

## Differentiation
- Purpose-built specifically for retail applications
- Uses consumer-centric language to bridge the gap between consumer vocabulary and product attributes
- Offers a customized, human-powered product taxonomy with over 20,000 product attributes
- Focuses on practical, immediate impact rather than theoretical applications
- Enhances both digital and in-store shopping experiences

## Pricing Model
Not explicitly mentioned on the webpage.

title: Project: Population and Disease Prevalence Analysis for Cedars-Sinai Urgent Care todo list
goal: Estimate the permanent resident population within a 2-mile radius of Cedars-Sinai Urgent Care in Beverly Hills, considering local geography. Then, using Los Angeles County Department of Public Health data, project disease prevalence in this population based on epidemiological statistics. Create a comprehensive visualization report with informative charts illustrating these findings.
content:
# Todo List

## Project: Population and Disease Prevalence Analysis for Cedars-Sinai Urgent Care

### Tasks:
1. [ ] Locate Cedars-Sinai Urgent Care in Beverly Hills
   - [ ] Find exact address and coordinates
   - [ ] Verify location on map

2. [ ] Determine 2-mile radius area
   - [ ] Calculate geographical boundaries
   - [ ] Identify neighborhoods within radius

3. [ ] Estimate population within radius
   - [ ] Gather census data for the area
   - [ ] Calculate population density
   - [ ] Estimate total permanent resident population

4. [ ] Gather LA County Public Health data
   - [ ] Find official epidemiological statistics
   - [ ] Identify relevant disease prevalence data
   - [ ] Download/extract necessary datasets

5. [ ] Analyze disease prevalence for the area
   - [ ] Apply county-level statistics to local population
   - [ ] Account for demographic variations
   - [ ] Calculate disease prevalence estimates

6. [ ] Create visualizations and charts
   - [ ] Population density map
   - [ ] Disease prevalence charts
   - [ ] Comparative analysis visualizations

7. [ ] Compile comprehensive report
   - [ ] Write methodology section
   - [ ] Present findings with visualizations
   - [ ] Include data sources and limitations

8. [ ] Deliver final report to user

- [ ] Analyze header structure (H1, H2, etc.)
- [ ] Check for schema markup
- [ ] Analyze internal linking structure
- [ ] Check for broken links
- [ ] Verify SSL implementation
- [ ] Check for duplicate content issues

- [ ] Assess readability and user engagement elements

## 4. Assess Website Performance Metrics

- [ ] Analyze Core Web Vitals
- [ ] Identify performance bottlenecks
- [ ] Check for render-blocking resources

## 5. Check Mobile Friendliness and Responsiveness

## 6. Analyze Backlink Profile and Domain Authority

- [ ] Identify referring domains

## 7. Compile Comprehensive SEO Audit Report

- [ ] Deliver report to user
